text: hi everyone we get tano here the
internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of this new boris
album heavy rocks uh 2022. japanese rock
drone and metal outfit boris they're
back but did they ever really leave
no not really they are adding once again
to their massive and ever-growing
discography yes they are doing that but
also adding to their heavy rock series
here this is the third installment now
making it a trilogy long story short the
band dropped one of the heaviest and
most rockin records in their discography
back in 2002 it was titled heavy rocks
stylistically this one had a very
crushing stoner metal and rock flavor to
it and i guess they decided this album
and direction was so good that they
would pretty much do it again uh almost
10 years later with heavy rocks released
in 2011. same title same cover but with
a different color and now they're doing
it again around 10 years later again
with the same title but a different
color i guess more of a leopard print
this time around and it's a boris album
so of course it's going to be heavy
there will be an undercurrent of doom
and stoner metal in there but heavy
rocks 2022 is easily the wildest fastest
and most upbeat installment in the heavy
rock series so far the riffs and campy
vocals don't even feel as indebted to
stoner metal and rock as they do heavy
metal and hard rock there's a dash of
thrash in there occasionally too not in
the same way that we heard on 2021's no
this time around it's a bit scuzzier and
weirder the track my name is blank even
sounds like an old guar song but
delivered with a punk ferocity and a
noisier mix and yeah chaos noise classic
metal riffs and over-the-top vocals is
pretty much the name of the game on this
record she is burning for example
features not just some very heavy refuge
but also these hard panned searing lead
guitars that are just deafening there
are some driving drums and epic horn
sections on the track too easily one of
the most balls to the wall songs boris
has ever recorded but the camp on the
track cramper takes the form of these
really cartoonish mutant group vocals
it's like there's a chorus of gremlins
in the background saying you believe in
desire
plus the hair metal hook on this track
you really like it
there's a bridge on the song that sounds
like dude is changing into a werewolf
with all of his screams
ringing out into the night all the out
there [ __ ] packed into this track is
maybe a little disruptive it's maybe a
little much but still it has one of the
most solid and kick-ass songs at the
core of it past here there is a bit of a
lull around the midpoint of this lp
there's blah blah blah which slows
things down with a very spacious mix
fuzz bass primal drums tons of reverb on
those guitars there's a devilish groove
to it but the bright and ethereal vocal
harmonies that hit on what i guess is a
chorus just are too short-winded it's
not enough and if this track is as wild
and as free a
jam as the performance implies it could
have gone wilder then question 1 turns
up the heat and speed again but with a
mix that kind of sucks everything on it
feels just smushed down to a
claustrophobic degree except for the
vocals which ride really loud and high
above everything else and have this
synthetic processing on them maybe
they're pitched to some degree either
way it's not the most flattering but i
do have to say this is one of the more
unique songs i've heard in this style i
mean just leave it up to boris to pull
that off especially with this sudden
psychedelic doom breakdown in the middle
of the track which uh doesn't have the
smoothest segway in and out the song
ruins kind of runs in a similar
direction stylistically with those
pumping riffs and those touched up
vocals but uh way more blunt of a song
structure no breakdown or anything like
that it's just kick ass from front to
back then nosferatu is another slow
burner on the record where the band goes
back to their drony and down tuned roots
it's slow it's heavy a lot of space a
lot of volume this track could have even
been on their deer record back in 2017
and true it's far from the worst borah
song i've heard but
have they done better yes does it stick
out like a sore thumb on this lp yes are
some of the riffs and rhythms we do get
on this track uh in a few spare moments
a little out of sync yes but the
unsettling coral harmonies as well as
the wailing saxes do add an interesting
dynamic here and it does sound genuinely
eerie and strange at points overall it's
okay i think it's a bit of a wash then
we have the last leg where things just
sort of go
everywhere ghostly imagination has
almost this oompa quality to the beat
there are some really fried guitars in
the mix as well easily the most unhinged
sounding cut here especially with these
garish vocal harmonies and deafening
guitar leads just kind of flying and
smothering everything i kind of admire
it for being as noisy and as ugly as it
is boris really embracing some chaotic
evil here and just making something
that's challenging and freakish the
track chain sees the band completely not
giving a [ __ ] too with lots of blasted
drums fiery distortion washed out vocals
and so much bleed going on in the mix
like every piece of instrumentation is
smothering every other piece of
instrumentation it's like a psychedelic
noise metal it's kind of sick the band
saves the slowest and most dramatic cut
on this lp for last with the kind of
heavy and patient piano passages you
would expect out of a lingua ignota
record topped with these sort of
distorted pained whaling lead vocals
there's a lot of passion there but the
progression is slow sort of patience
testing not exactly edge of your seat
and while it does thicken up and get
kind of heavy at points the abrupt
finish here isn't exactly climactic
still heavy rocks 2022 is still a pretty
solid album overall from boris lots of
kick-ass tracks kick-ass riffs kick-ass
songs kick-ass vocals it does lose
momentum here and there during the
slower and sludgier moments these spots
i think could have used a little
something extra some developments some
layers
something to make them feel more
connected to the speedier and harder
hitting cuts here but for the most part
this record is still a very good time
and it sounds like boris had a lot of
fun with this one feeling a decent two
